1.desc: It's time to discuss basic combat techniques!
1.name: Basics of Battle

2.desc: Memorize the strengths and weaknesses of each elements and how to trigger the Brave Burst!
2.name: Element & Skill

10.desc: Your journey as a Summoner traveling across Grand Gaia has begun! Go forth, and don't forget what Tilith taught you!
10.name: Start of Adventure

11.desc: The calm grasslands keep on going.The monsters here are just right for a beginner.Keep moving forward.
11.name: Monsters of the Prairie

12.desc: You can see a rocky mountain faintly on the horizon. Tilith is waiting at the "Cave of Flames" just beyond here.
12.name: Guardians of the Prairie

20.desc: The magma flowing within this cave gives off an intense heat. The enemies in this cave have the power of fire.
20.name: Cave of Dancing Flames

21.desc: Continue deeper into the Cave of Flames. Beings who control fire are waiting ahead.
21.name: Wielder of the Fire

22.desc: You've come far, but there's still no exit in site. There are supposed to be bandits in this area.
22.name: The Thief's Hideout

23.desc: Looks like you'll be able to leave this cave soon, but there seems to be something sinister awaiting you at the end.
23.name: The Blazing Beast

30.desc: You've emerged into a blizzard. It's so cold, watch out for enemies with water attacks.
30.name: Breath Freezing Snowfields

31.desc: You are making progress, but the end of the snowscape still isn't visible. Don't forget to plan for water enemies.
31.name: Manipulator of the Water

32.desc: You've reached the center of the icy field. Beware, apparently there are pirates about on the ice...
32.name: The Pirate on Ice

33.desc: The end of this cold snow field has come into view at last. However, it seems one of Maxwell's knights is waiting just ahead.
33.name: The Dragon Hunting Ice Knight

40.desc: Beyond the snow lie the forests that the sun doesn't reach. Beware, there are signs of monsters are all around.
40.name: Shadowy Forests

41.desc: This monster-packed forest just goes on forever. Everything's the same, seems like you're walking in circles...
41.name: Puppeteer of the Trees

42.desc: It's said that bandits occupy this forest. They may be tough, but there's no way to avoid them.
42.name: Bandit of the Forest

43.desc: Dangerous hunters wielding longbows inhabit the depths of this forest, and they attack anyone who dares enter.
43.name: Hunter from the Forest

50.desc: Lightning occasionally roars throughout this damp land. It's quite unpleasant here. Prepare yourself for thunder.
50.name: Thunder Blasting Wetlands

51.desc: It looks to be a vast wetland. The terrain may prove more troublesome than the thunder-wielding enemies hiding in it.
51.name: Commander of the Thunder

52.desc: Seems there are bandits around here, too. They used to call the skies their own, but what strength that must've taken...
52.name: Pirate of the Wetlands

53.desc: At the end of these unpleasant wetlands the way is blocked by a former hero of Grand Gaia who was summoned by Maxwell.
53.name: The Thundering Strategist

60.desc: These ancient ruins have a solemn, holy air. It's much better than where you were before, but it's still ominous.
60.name: Sacred Ruins

61.desc: It appears that a sage with the power of light is in the ruins. A guardian, perhaps?
61.name: Wielder of the Light

62.desc: A shining, gallant white horse blocks the path. It defends its position, attacking mercilessly.
62.name: The White Horse of Light

63.desc: A warrior of light lies in wait in the depths of these ruins, testing adventurers before they're allowed to pass.
63.name: Moonlit Battle

70.desc: This spine-chillingly eerie mansion reeks of an evil presence. Here you'll need the power to oppose darkness.
70.name: The Heinous Chamber

71.desc: Light energy is strong against dark, but it's also its weakness. You must plan your strategy here carefully.
71.name: Manipulator of the Dark

72.desc: A monster with snakes for arms has appeared. Beware, it seems many adventurers have been subdued by its strength.
72.name: The Cursed Snake

73.desc: A grotesque swordsman awaits you, and you must overcome him in order to reach the Tower of Mistral.
73.name: The Monster Slaying Blade

81.desc: You've reached the Tower of Mistral at last. This is Maxwell's base inside Mistral. Hurry your way inside!
81.name: The Skyhigh Tower

82.desc: This tower reaches amazingly high into the sky. Fearsome monsters await with blood-soaked claws.
82.name: Monsters of the Corridor

83.desc: Halfway up, a giant flying dragon is defends the tower, attacking anyone who nears. You must avoid it's attacks to advance.
83.name: The Stairs of Trial

84.desc: Masters of each of the four elements stand in wait as the final barrier in the path to the lord of the tower.
84.name: The Pillars of Force

85.desc: You're almost at the top. A mechanical deity, likely Maxwell's creation, awaits. The final battle for Mistral begins.
85.name: The Forged Gigantor

90.desc: There is a mountain range at the end of the Egor Plains where it is said an evil god who once destroyed several small nations slumbers.
90.name: Asleep in the Ice

200.desc: Your journey through Morgan begins in a huge desert. The scorching haze indicates the fierce battle to come.
200.name: The Burning Desert

201.desc: The bandits in this burning desert have much stronger resolve that those in Mistral, and it seems they intend to block your way.
201.name: Bandit of the Desert

202.desc: A summoned being known as the king of beasts is rampaging in the desert. A fierce battle with him is unavoidable.
202.name: The Precarious Beast Master

203.desc: You've reached the desert's mid point. An incarnation of flames blocks the way, further scorching the land around it.
203.name: Incarnation of Flames

204.desc: The end of the desert is in view, and the wind now smells of the sea. However, a giant silhouette stands blocks your path...
204.name: The Power Seeking Swordsman

210.desc: You've reached the shore, escaping the desert. A calm, beautiful beach awaits you, but you must still be cautious.
210.name: The Endless Shores

211.desc: A huge ship is anchored on the beach. It's a pirate ship, and it seems there's no easy way past...
211.name: Pirate of the Shallow Waters

212.desc: The beautiful view continues, as do the number of enemies you encounter. Prepare yourself for a water assault.
212.name: Knight of the Ripples

213.desc: The end of the coastline is now in view. A Water Spirit is said to appear around here. How strong could it be?
213.name: Incarnation of Water

214.desc: You've finally reached the coast's end. A dark forest is visible ahead, but surely something is lurking near...
214.name: Princess of the Icy Blade

220.desc: Your eyes haven't adjusted to the dark since coming in from the coast. Are Karl and the others OK?
220.name: Pitch Dark Forests

221.desc: Dark forests like this are usually full of bandits. Is it that they work better in the Dark? Either way, be careful.
221.name: Thief of the Forest

222.desc: The discomfort you felt in the forests of Mistral is back, but this time it's worse. Could this be the work of a time mage?
222.name: The Hunter of Time

223.desc: It's hard telling which trees are just trees and not just monsters in hiding. If only you could escape this forest...
223.name: Incarnation of the Forest

224.desc: The darkness has lightened. The exit should be close, but there's tension in the air. Surely, the sime of a formidable foe.
224.name: The Earth Shattering Spear

230.desc: After escaping the pitch black forest, you entered a vast wasteland. The area is being torn apart by lightning.
230.name: The Thunder Wrecked Land

231.desc: You move forward as lightning strikes down all around you. Beware of incoming aerial attacks.
231.name: Thief from the Skies

232.desc: You're nearing the center of the wastelands. Did Karl and his team successfully bring down the demon they were chasing?
232.name: The Bewitching Tactician

233.desc: There's a temple barely visible in the distance. There's no sign of Karl, what has happened to him...
233.name: Incarnation of Thunder

234.desc: A summoned thunder king is blocking the path at the end of the wasteland. You must defeat him before continuing.
234.name: A Flash of Lightning

240.desc: There is a temple bathed in light. Despite it being thousands of years old, it's as beautiful as the day it was built.
240.name: Land of the Light

241.desc: You continue even deeper into the massive temple. You can make out the solemn silhouettes of pegasi standing about.
241.name: The Magnificent Pegasus

242.desc: You've nearly reached the middle of the temple. You can imagine the days when many would gather at this impressive alter.
242.name: Guardian of the Light

243.desc: You can feel the enemies growing stronger the deeper you go. Unfortunately, the only way to the Tower of Morgan is forward.
243.name: Incarnation of the Light

244.desc: You reached the temple's innermost area. A mighty swordsman awaits you, and you can surely expect a fierce battle...
244.name: Sword of Lightning Speed

250.desc: You see ruins as you escape from the temple. It seems that whatever existed here before was destroyed by a great power.
250.name: The Land Devoured by Monsters

251.desc: As you proceed, you realize the ruins cover a large area. It must have been a large city before.
251.name: The Lusting Snake

252.desc: You've come to a plaza in the middle of the ruins. An enormous church embodies the former power of this devastated city.
252.name: Face of a Saint

253.desc: Leaving the church, you continue through the ruins. The temple was so beautifully preserved, what could've happened here?
253.name: Incarnation of the Dark

254.desc: You reached the ruins' end. The majestic Tower of Morgan stands before you. However, a knight in thick armor awaits...
254.name: The Peculiar Black Knight

260.desc: Don't let Karl and Seria's wishes go to waste. Ascend the tower quickly and track down Abaddon and Graham!
260.name: The Never-Ending Tower

261.desc: This tower is like a gigantic fortress. The spiral stairs that surround its vast outer walls are the only way up...
261.name: Stairway to the Heavens

262.desc: Is this only the halfway point? You can still hear the cries from the fierce battle raging below... It's time to hurry.
262.name: Dance of Lightning Flames

263.desc: Past the halfway point, warriors summoned by Maxwell and Abaddon block the path. There's no turning back now.
263.name: Gale of the Ice Tree

264.desc: The Stairway to the Heavens has narrowed. You can no longer hear the shouts from the base. You're almost there.
264.name: Shadowless Creatures

265.desc: You've reached the top at last. Continue on and defeat Abaddon and Graham, you can't let Karl and the others down!
265.name: The Eroding Barricade

300.desc: You're now in Maxwell's stronghold, St. Lamia. Many tall mountains are visible in the distance. The land looks rugged.
300.name: Scorching Trails

301.desc: Magma is gushing out all over, and it's scorching hot as far as the eye can see. Nothing could possibly live here.
301.name: Watchdog From Hell

302.desc: It's getting hotter and hotter as you near the mouth of the volcano. It's getting hard to even move...
302.name: Wings of the Flaming Skies

303.desc: You finally made it through the pass. The intense heat hasn't gone, but at least it's all downhill from here. Hurry on ahead.
303.name: The Banished Fire Dragon

304.desc: Just as you were about to escape the volcano, it seems an undead beast is blocking your path...
304.name: Phoenix of the Volcano

310.desc: You've emerged from the base of a mountain. Now it's intensely cold, and it seems to be taking its toll on Tilith.
310.name: Mountain Snowstorm

311.desc: Unlike the Volcano Eldent, this blizzard-covered sacred mountain has many steep cliffs. Watch your step.
311.name: The Captivated Water Sprite

312.desc: This place is also inhabitable. It's doubtful anyone could even last a minute around here. Hurry on ahead.
312.name: The Spring of Power

313.desc: Around the summit, stones are stacked in a alter-like pattern. Is this proof that the mountain was a place of worship?
313.name: Ruler of the Water

314.desc: The summit is in sight, and you've spotted the altar. The end is near, but there are signs of a beast nearby...
314.name: The Mountain-dwelling Devil

320.desc: Beyond the sacred mountain lies the Blood Forest. Tilith is acting a bit odd, though, she might be sick...
320.name: To the Crimson Forests

321.desc: A sea of red surrounds you as you walk through this forest. The grass, the flowers, everythings red. What's the meaning of this?
321.name: Frail Spirit of the Forests

322.desc: You continue deeper into the crimson forest. Suddenly, drops as red as blood fall down on you from the trees above.
322.name: Discord of the Earth

323.desc: You feel your senses numbing as you're enveloped in a sea of red. It's probably not a good idea to stick around here.
323.name: Maiden of the Trees

324.desc: You've finally reached the end of the crimson forest. You see a color other than red and race towards it.
324.name: The World Tree

330.desc: You're halfway through St. Lamia, and Tilith's deteriorating condition has worsened. It's time to hurry.
330.name: The Tarnished Peaks

331.desc: Mt. Wistorea is the steepest in the area, but its calm weather makes it the most comfortable environment so far.
331.name: Cyclops of Lightning

332.desc: Hold off the hordes of giants as you move forward. You can't waste time with Tilith's current condition.
332.name: Float Like a Butterfly

333.desc: The Thunderbird circles above, letting out a piercing cry. You've no choice but to confront it and take it down.
333.name: The Riotous Thunderbird

334.desc: You can make out St. Lamia Palace in the distance, but the roar of a beast from the foothills nearby are concerning...
334.name: The Raged Beast of Destruction

340.desc: You come across a clearing bathed in a dazzling light, but as Tilith's curse is growing stronger there is no time to enjoy it.
340.name: Forbidden Sacred Grounds

341.desc: This area is obviously sacred, bathed in light and covered in green, but being so close to St. Lamia Palace surely strong foes await.
341.name: The Flourishing Garden

342.desc: Without provocation, hordes of shining demons swoop down on you. These demons must've been called upon by Maxwell...
342.name: Knight of the Light

343.desc: Seems even a holy goddess has been called on to block your path. However, you must defeat her and press on if you're to save Tilith.
343.name: The Goddess of War

344.desc: The exit is in sight, but a giant entity can be seen swooping down from the heavens, possibly to deliver your final trial...
344.name: Conqueror of the Heavens

350.desc: In a complete change of scenery, you come across a dark, rancid cave. Pass through this, and St. Lamia Palace awaits.
350.name: A Putrid Abyss

351.desc: This cave not only looks horrid, but is also full to the brim with fearsome beings. You mustn't lose focus here or else.
351.name: Vagabond of the Monster's Den

352.desc: There is a nagging chill in the air, though it isn't necessarily cold. Could it be this malicious air that surrounds you?
352.name: Dwelling of the Souls

353.desc: It seems you've reached the dark, damp reaches of this hellish cave. Follow the wind to find your way out.
353.name: The Midnight Aristocrat

354.desc: You seem to have finally figured your way out of the cave, but all of the sudden an unsettling evil presence descends upon you...
354.name: The Death-beckoning Devil

360.desc: You've finally reached Maxwell's stronghold. You continue forward, having vowed to Tilith to destroy this depraved god.
360.name: To the Abominable Castle

361.desc: This castle once was revered for its majesty. While still impressive, it's surrounded in a sinister atmosphere.
361.name: The Gates of Hell

362.desc: As expected, Maxwell has filled his base with incredibly powerful beings. Liberating them is going to be difficult.
362.name: The Phony Paradise

363.desc: You've entered the castle's banquet hall. The sacred walls reek of wickedness, but you mustn't hesitate. Advance, for Tilith!
363.name: Saint and Devil

364.desc: You can feel the fallen god's presence grow stronger as you proceed. However, surely he has set up a powerful defensive line before him.
364.name: The Fourfold Pillar

365.desc: At last, you've reached Maxwell. The battle to save Tilith and destroy the first of the four fallen gods begins now...
365.name: Creator of the World

400.desc: Amdahl, one of the islands in the Palmyna Archipelago which is ruled over by Cardes the Malevolent. A town can be seen near the entrance, having been devastated by war.
400.name: The Scars of War

401.desc: Past the damaged houses lies nothing but fiery ruins. Could these flames be the work of monsters?
401.name: Abandoned Ruins

402.desc: You can feel the flames growing stronger. This might be a sign that something dangerous is waiting ahead.
402.name: Presence of Flames

403.desc: When lightning strikes it sometimes ignites the earth where it hits. The force that controls the lightning and flames has set their aim on you.
403.name: Of Thunder and Flames

404.desc: A figure watches you from the shadows as you attempt to leave the village. It seems all the intense fighting has attracted the attention of a fire god.
404.name: In Comes a Fire God

410.desc: Monsters snarl in unison as they scheme to make you their main dish at this ghost ship party.
410.name: Party On Board

411.desc: What could be waiting unbeknownst to history in this ship that appeared so long ago? You can't deny your curiosity.
411.name: Venture Inside

412.desc: You can hear a water dragon's roar even from inside the ship. Is this howl meant to get rid of those who disturb the souls of the dead crew members?
412.name: Dragon's Roar

413.desc: As you try to escape the ghost ship to investigate, a frigid swordsman appears before you, along with his sword techniques which can turn anything to ice.
413.name: Frozen Blades

414.desc: It seems you must leave Amdahl if you are to defeat Cardes, but before that you need to escape the ghost ship.
414.name: A Water God Appears

420.desc: You stop in a field, surprised by a mysterious man who now blocks your path. There's no time to loiter, you need to shake your fear and push ahead.
420.name: Windswept Prairie

421.desc: On your way toward Amdahl Castle, an incredibly graceful figure appears before you. Vanquish it and move ahead.
421.name: The Graceful Figure

422.desc: You've come to a prairie covered in trees and shrubs, but what is that lurking in the shadows, seemingly ready to strike...
422.name: From Forest's Shadow

423.desc: Nearing a pond at the edge of the prairie, some Water Nymphs stand in your way as if they're protecting something. What could it be?
423.name: Princess of the Pond

424.desc: On your way from the prairie, someone has been sent to block your path. Carefully proceed forward.
424.name: The Gallant Earth God

430.desc: After parting with Karl and Seria you proceed through the mines. Making your way through the monster infested tunnels, you come across a decaying bridge.
430.name: The Rotting Bridge

431.desc: It seems the demon Graham who escaped from Mistral has shown up around here. Could this strong presence coming from ahead be him? Or maybe...
431.name: Enlightenment of the Ages

432.desc: Continuing through the mines, you occasionally here the sound of thunder. Whether it's natural or the roar of some thunder beast, surely you'll find out soon.
432.name: Where Thunder Pulses

433.desc: The center of the mine is full of traps. Blades are also quickly flashing about. Eliminate those who stand in your way and advance!
433.name: Lightning Quick Attack

434.desc: A sanctuary can be seen shining just beyond the mine. The exit seems to be within reach. All you have to do is defeat the enemies before you.
434.name: A Thunder God Strikes

440.desc: According to a mysterious old man, this sanctuary holds information on the Four Heroes of Old. Take a quick detour and check it out.
440.name: Forest Sanctuary

441.desc: A warrior carrying a massive sword appears before you as you're searching for information on the Four Heroes. He swings at you as he approaches.
441.name: Descending Force

442.desc: The sunlight shining on the sanctuary is as pleasant as Tilith said it would be, but who is this coming in to bathe in the light the same as she would have...
442.name: Radiant Helix

443.desc: A gunshot suddenly echoes through the solemn sanctuary interior. As startled as you are, you see a shining marksman before you.
443.name: Hades Blast

444.desc: There doesn't seem to be any particularly important information in the sanctuary. It's time to end your detour and set your sites back on Amdahl Castle.
444.name: Light God's Progression

450.desc: According to Karl and Seria, Graham has already left this place. However, you should still be cautious as you proceed.
450.name: Never Ending Rain

451.desc: The remains of a city thought to have at one time prided itself on its extravagance. It seems someone is controlling the spirits who would otherwise be at rest here.
451.name: Dark Night Requiem

452.desc: Your senses suddenly heighten. Could it be this intense blood-thirsty presence you feel up ahead? It's already too late to turn back.
452.name: A Thirst for Blood

453.desc: You pick up an item while advancing through the destroyed city. It's a powerful magic barrier, the likes of which have never been seen.
453.name: Pure Magic Barrier

454.desc: As you exit Edila you're able to see the entrance to Amdahl Castle, but suddenly, a figure consumed by darkness blocks your way forward.
454.name: A Dark God Emerges

460.desc: Amdahl Castle, where vengeful ghosts of the past are said to reside. Through here is the only way to get to Palmyna, the land sealed away by Cardes the Malevolent.
460.name: The Commander's Power

461.desc: According to Elder Grah, a vengeful ghost that resents humans lives here. Still, you mustn't lose your way, even if only to prevent yourself from becoming a ghost as well.
461.name: The Commander's Skill

462.desc: The beautifully decorated interior of the castle suggests that at one time many an extravagant banquet was held here. But all relics aside, it's time to head further inside.
462.name: The Princess' Ball

463.desc: There is light and darkness wherever you go. But still, where did the darkness in the Amdahl Empire come from? There's probably no longer anyone around that knows.
463.name: Dark Surge

464.desc: The end of Amdahl, the first island in the Palmyna Archipelago, is within sight. However, there are still some rather troublesome enemies about...
464.name: Light Pulse

465.desc: You sense a strikingly ominous presence coming from the path ahead. What awaits you isn't a god like before, but some being with a strong resentment toward humans.
465.name: Malevolent Ceremony

500.desc: Encervis, the second island in the Palmyna Archipelago. You first come across its scorching hot volcanic ash covered hills.
500.name: The Ash Covered Hill

501.desc: As you head toward Cardes, your way is blocked by nymphs and dragons that command the power of fire. Their presence is like that of an overwhelming pillar of flames.
501.name: The Flames that Rule

502.desc: You can hear the cry of not one beast but many coming from the fiery hills. Who could possibly command such fearful roars?
502.name: Dinner for Watchdogs

503.desc: Fire has both the power to incinerate everything and to restore life. Harnessing these powers, fallen gods continue to roam these lands as they always have.
503.name: Death and Rebirth

504.desc: As you cross over the ash stained hills, a figure blanketed in black flames appears before you. A smile comes across your face, delighted to have come across such a warrior.
504.name: The Black Flame Warrior

510.desc: You cross over the ash covered hills to find a beautiful lakeside. However, before you can rest another horde of new monsters appear before you.
510.name: Broken Silence

511.desc: As you're searching the lakeside, you suddenly see a great shadow on the surface of the water. It's likely the ruler of Lake Aldela.
511.name: The Lakeside Master

512.desc: While gazing upon the beautiful lake, you hear a lovely singing voice. However you mustn't be seduced by it, because the being it's coming from surely isn't human.
512.name: The Lake's Allure

513.desc: You proceed alongside the lake, headed toward the Sky Fort. Alongside the light of the sun being reflected off the lake is the reflection of a single icy blade.
513.name: The Ice Cold Warrior

514.desc: The path toward the old castle is open before you on the other side of the lake. However before you waits a sea god, wearing a fearless smile.
514.name: The Ocean Master

520.desc: Now knowing how dangerous the Sky Fort really is, you must put all you have into taking it down per Elder Grah's request.
520.name: The Castle Gates Open

521.desc: The Sky Fort is still far off. A faint magical power lingers in the pleasantly windblown air within the old castle. What could it be?
521.name: Castle Winds

522.desc: One can feel the history of Castle Avenia in all its elegance. After its original lord perished, a new royal family settled in.
522.name: Fairy Royalty

523.desc: Among the many remaining legendary epics, there is a tale of a young boy who saved the World Tree. Could this be what has shown itself just now?
523.name: World Tree and the Savior

524.desc: An otherworldly warrior with some tricks up his sleeve blocks your exit from the old castle. He attacks with an indiscriminate barrage of gunfire!
524.name: Deception of the Spirit World

530.desc: There is a rumor about a monster that lives in this ravine that turns everything it sees into stone. There are few who view this widely known ghost story as being true.
530.name: Curse of the Ravine

531.desc: As a stiff wind blows down on you from the ravine making it difficult to even stand, in an instant the sky grows dark. You look up to see something hovering above you...
531.name: The Divine Wind Blows

532.desc: You look below to see a horrifyingly deep ravine. A thunderous roar can be heard from deep beneath. A single massive eye peeks at you.
532.name: One Eyed Giant

533.desc: Two beasts block your path forward through the Gadillian Ravine. One has an enormous body, while the other is a wild and beastly warrior.
533.name: Thunderous Nemeses

534.desc: In this harshly windblown wasteland exists a lone warrior whose solitary lifestyle aptly befits their surroundings.
534.name: Noble War Hero

540.desc: Karl and Seria, will those two be able to fight their way out of this predicament? There's no time to worry as a monster with a taste for mischief appears before you.
540.name: Mischief and Malice

541.desc: There is a solemn atmosphere in the mausoleum where the natives pray to their god of light. However, there isn't enough time to investigate this supposed god any further...
541.name: The Meaning of Holiness

542.desc: You progress through the Alman Mausoleum, keeping your eye on the Sky Fort. Sensing a strong presence, you turn to find a warrior waving a large sword.
542.name: Long Blade Warrior

543.desc: One's belonging to the light is not set in stone. This is because one can never be fully clear that their principles are just. One must prove their righteousness with their blade.
543.name: Blade of the Victor

544.desc: What could that knight be thinking? How could anyone who fought and died for humanity's sake find themselves fighting for the gods!?
544.name: Where the Light Shines

550.desc: You feel the ominous presence of countless lost souls wandering about the area. What could this evil force be amidst the sorrowful howls?
550.name: Sea of Wicked Thoughts

551.desc: A devilish presence stands before you as a hazardous obstacle in your path. Be careful not to get seduced into a vulnerable state.
551.name: Vile Dreams Come True

552.desc: Monsters rush at you as if under some sort of spell. This appears to be a challenge from one who possesses power that transcends even death.
552.name: The Endlessly Dying Witch

553.desc: Resentment is one of the strongest emotions people have. Though it can sometimes be used as a motivating force to accomplish a goal, there are few who desire it.
553.name: Wicked Hostility

554.desc: You look up to see the Sky Fort! Have faith in Tilith and push your way through this final obstacle!
554.name: The Skies Above

560.desc: Escape the Sky Fort for the sake of the wounded Tilith and those who stand guard over her! Mow down any who stand in your way!
560.name: Escape the Sky Fort

561.desc: Hordes of monsters are blocking your path. Defeat them all as you advance forth! You've nearly made your way to Zebra!
561.name: Evade the Oncoming Hordes

562.desc: The monsters' aggression grows stronger as if they're trying to buy time for Zebra to recover from the wounds he was dealt during his battle with Tilith.
562.name: Endless Barrage

563.desc: Your enemies' aggression continues to grow, but as long as your comrades are behind you there's no choice but to fight your way forth.
563.name: No Turning Back

564.desc: You're reached the deepest reaches of the Sky Fort. Zebra is close at hand, but your way is blocked by what were some of the greatest warriors to have ever lived.
564.name: The Commander's Pets

565.desc: Powerful enough to surpass even a goddess, the demonic Zebra is waiting just ahead. Strengthen your will as preparedness may become a vital weapon in the end.
565.name: The Mad God Descends

570.desc: Mysterious ruins were discovered in Encervis. It seems that a fiendish apparition haunts the place...
570.name: The Ruins Where the Queen Nests

600.desc: Your sights now rest on Cardes, one of the Four Fallen Gods. However the path ahead is scorching hot due to the blistering hot sun above.
600.name: The Scorched Pathway

601.desc: You've arrived at the increadibly hot Dejour Ruins. Monsters trapped in the red hot winds block your way forth.
601.name: Raging Heat Wave

602.desc: A man-eating demon and an ancient dragon wrapped in flames block the path toward Obselion Castle where Tilith awaits you.
602.name: The Great Wall

603.desc: Thirst and hunger line the scorching path ahead. In the steamy distance awaits a chef unmoved by the heat. What ingredients could she be looking for?
603.name: The Commander of Flames

604.desc: Two warriors, locked in combat since long ago, take a break from their intense fighting to block your way forward.
604.name: A Blistering Exchange

610.desc: The royal family of Palmyna once resided in this magnificent castle. It's beautifully frozen corridors now give off a feeling of sadness.
610.name: The Ice Covered Castle

611.desc: The castle grounds are silent, and Tilith is nowhere to be found. There's nothing but frozen hallways leading in each direction.
611.name: Frozen Halls

612.desc: A brisk wind blows upon you as you continue investigating the castle grounds.  The cool breeze feels like an invitation to death...
612.name: Frigid Breath

613.desc: You couldn't find Tilith, but just as Grahdens said, you must put your faith in her and move forth. Your goal is to defeat Cardes.
613.name: The Path Forward

614.desc: As you try to escape the castle, you come to a giant wall of ice. Worse than that, two daunting warriors are lying in wait for you.
614.name: Beast Above the Wall

620.desc: After parting from Seria and Karl, you head toward the place where Cardes is sealed away, vanquishing enemies who appear from the silent forest.
620.name: In the Sunlight

621.desc: All manner of beasts try and stand in your way as you work towards the Spirit World, the land where Cardes is sealed away...
621.name: The Shadow in the Trees

622.desc: It's been countless years since the last of the humans died out, but still the forest doesn't sleep. It seems it has thrived in their absence.
622.name: The Forest's Savior

623.desc: Proceeding along a lightly foggy path, you come across the rulers of the forest. The ruler of trees and the master of fairies now stand before you.
623.name: Forest of the Nymphs

624.desc: Those with great power are often overcome by it. However, legend speaks of one mighty warrior who succeeded in gaining control.
624.name: Living with Might

630.desc: Grandelt was once the most vibrant city in Palmyna, but it has since turned into a ghost town. Lined with abandoned buildings, it now stands in ruins.
630.name: The Crumbling City

631.desc: Tilith injured herself investigating how to get to the Spirit World. You must repay her by making your way to Cardes!
631.name: Race Through the City

632.desc: You're now headed for the Noera Battlegrounds. However, the sky suddenly turns black as you look up to see a massive figure above.
632.name: The Sky Devouring Bird

633.desc: Escaping between the rows of crumbling buildings, you're jolted by a sudden tremor. Could this be Gaia's rage? Or maybe...
633.name: The Trembling Earth

634.desc: The Heroes of Old longed for the life of a lone warrior, and if ever two of such warriors should meet their joy would rain down like lightning.
634.name: A Thunderous Attack

640.desc: Grahdens's question planted a seed in its wake. However this is no time to get distracted. You must repay the goddess's favor.
640.name: A Response to Devotion

641.desc: Many students with bright futures ahead of them once studied here. The presence awaiting you in this sacred place is one clad in light.
641.name: Where Light Falls

642.desc: Lorand, one of the Heroes of Old. The place where he once taught as a professor has now been overtaken by dangerous monsters.
642.name: The Mischievous Goddess

643.desc: A brightly shining gun-wielding warrior stands before you. You must fight against this force which threatens to rip away your very soul.
643.name: Invitation to Heaven

644.desc: The atmosphere is ominously heavy in this solemn seminary. Maintain focus and keep moving forward.
644.name: Solemn Grounds

645.desc: Despite the rumors they were the strongest around, those two never crossed swords. Perhaps they understood what it really meant to be strong.
645.name: A Familiar Opponent

650.desc: This place once hosted a battle between humans and the gods. Even after many years, it still bears the scars of those days.
650.name: Scars from the Great War

651.desc: A spirit possessed by the thrill of battle, and the one who pursues it. As long as their fight continues, they will never disappear.
651.name: Dregs of Battle

652.desc: These grounds are haunted by those who couldn't be saved. It serves no purpose other than to create further casualties.
652.name: Those Who Covet Death

653.desc: The entrance to the Spirit World is now within view. All that's left is to believe in Tilith's words and move forth, knocking away any who get in your way.
653.name: The World in Her Eyes

654.desc: You come across an unending battle, where man and brute fight over who gets to lay claim to the other's soul.
654.name: The Endless Struggle

655.desc: You're now at the entrance to the Spirit World, but your way is blocked by two dark soldiers. Overflowing with power, their eyes brim with madness.
655.name: Frenzied Ballet

660.desc: You've all made your way to the Spirit World. Now you must put your heads together to defeat Cardes, and then get back together safely.
660.name: The Spirit World Descends

661.desc: The air is ominous where a Fallen God was once sealed away. You can feel the presence of enemies exponentially more powerful than any you've seen before.
661.name: Wavering Ambition

662.desc: The Spirit World grows unstable as the seal nears its breaking point. Uncertain of where Cardes may be, you must believe in your comrades and move forth!
662.name: Faith in Comrades

663.desc: Just as Tilith said, the seal is nearly broken. As you wonder how you should deal with it, hordes of crazed monsters are looking to prey on you.
663.name: The Seal Breaks

664.desc: The unstable seal reveals a being of dark and light from within it. However, an unexpected opponent has set their sights on you!
664.name: Light and Darkness Intersect

665.desc: You feel a wicked pulse coming from deep within the Spirit World, but before you can reach it you must defeat a once legendary hero.
665.name: A Formidable Presence

666.desc: The path to Cardes is now open. Now's your chance to put an end to him, and once again show your power over the gods!
666.name: The Open Seal

700.desc: A new investigation has begun into the land of Lizeria. The path to the once thriving La Veda Republic lies open, covered in weeds as it may be.
700.name: The Path Begins

701.desc: The crumbling paved road stretches forth, though there are no signs that humans ever lived in this area. Be cautious as you proceed.
701.name: Where Empires Meet

702.desc: How many years have passed since someone last walked this path? Surely this was a beautiful road back when it was taken care of.
702.name: Grove of Suspicion

703.desc: If you look closely it is obvious this road wasn't made this way by nature alone. It seems a great battle took place in this area.
703.name: A Feast for Humanoids

704.desc: The enemies attack quite aggressively. It's as if they're determined to keep anyone from setting foot inside the old capital.
704.name: The Young Girl's Guardian

705.desc: The end of the road is in sight. However, as you advance the monsters only grow in numbers. You must maintain focus as you move ahead.
705.name: The Giant's Dream

710.desc: Entering the mountains the sky grows dark. Could it be because of the smoke rising up from the volcanic ash? Dead trees line the path ahead.
710.name: The Ash-Covered Pass

711.desc: Though not hot enough to burn the skin, the air here is hot. In addition, it is also very thin. Do your best to retain consciousness.
711.name: Fire Breath, Thunder Fangs

712.desc: You must get out of here quickly
712.name: Flames in the Night

713.desc: There are now a lot of paths leading out. It looks like you'll be able to escape the mountains soon, however, you can feel something ahead, the presence of a strong enemy.
713.name: A Timeless Blaze

714.desc: The air is dry as always, but it's getting harder and harder to breath. After a short break, an intense roar echoes from afar.
714.name: The Crumbling God

720.desc: Before you lies a frozen lake. It seems the only way to get to the beach on the other side is to cross over it. Be careful as you proceed forth.
720.name: Treading on Thin Ice

721.desc: It is dry here as well, but for a different reason than it was up in the mountains. It's impossible to stand still in this cold. Could Lugina really be waiting here?
721.name: The Bullet in the Ice

722.desc: Step after shaky step, you cross the surface of the frozen lake. Looking back, you realize you've made it exactly halfway. How long will the ice hold?
722.name: Dragoon in the Shade

723.desc: A chilling wind blows across the lake. Attempting to shrug off the piercing cold, the temperature around you drops unnaturally. What could it be?
723.name: The Frozen Surface

724.desc: The shore is in view, you can finally get off the ice. Hurry up and get to the shore where there's no chance of slipping.
724.name: Frozen Lake's Trap

730.desc: You've come to an odd smelling marshland. A strange fog hangs above the water's bubbling bottomless surface. There's no use sticking around here any longer.
730.name: Boiling Muddy Water

731.desc: A stomach-turning stench fills the moist humid air. Even when the bad smell breaks, you're left with the choking fragrance of vegetation.
731.name: Endless Wisdom and Vitality

732.desc: Monsters leap in attack from both the muddied water as well as the thick shrubs. You'd like to catch your breath, but it seems there's nowhere to rest.
732.name: Beings from the Bush

733.desc: Suddenly, the miasma from the bog disappears. The air which was once difficult to breath is now fresh and clean. This is likely cause for concern.
733.name: Rooted to the Earth

734.desc: You've made it a long way down the muddy path. The end of the marsh is near, but a remarkably large tree stands in front of you. Surely it isn't an ordinary tree.
734.name: Roots in Nirvana

740.desc: Deep black storm clouds fill the sky. Lightning falls in endless waves upon the forest below. There's no way anything could live here.
740.name: Raining Flashes

741.desc: Your ears begin ringing as lightning endlessly crashes down. The air is thick with the odor of a burnt tree which has been struck by lightning.
741.name: Bursts of Lightning

742.desc: The trees here seem able to withstand exposure to lightning. However, in noticing this it seems you have become lost.
742.name: Plan for Eternity

743.desc: A paralyzing presence inhabits the forest. You recognize this aura. It seems a warrior you've faced before awaits you once again.
743.name: All-Piercing Lightning

744.desc: The sky has become brighter. It seems you might soon be able to escape this strange weather. Is Lugina waiting ahead like he said he'd be?
744.name: Stormy Surprise Attack

750.desc: You've arrived at the ruins of the La Veda Republic. As ravaged as it is, there are still traces in the rubble of the people who used to live here.
750.name: Flourishing Afterglow

751.desc: You notice elaborate carvings in the pieces of stone around your feet. The powderized remains of buildings speak of the violent battle that took place here.
751.name: Sword of Protection

752.desc: Despite how desolate these ruins are, there are no signs of weapons or human remains, and the air is fresh and clean.
752.name: Bright Flames, Bursting Light

753.desc: Continuing your search of the ruins, an overwhelming presence stops you in your tracks. Up ahead, a knight of the La Veda Republic lies in wait.
753.name: Knight of the Holy City

754.desc: Burnt houses, crumbling churches. There must've been many residents in a city as large as this. You can't help but hope that the victims have found peace.
754.name: A Young Girl's Wish

755.desc: Paris said there should be a shrine dedicated to the God of Light around here. A great force stands before you as if to protect the souls of those betrayed by the gods.
755.name: Proof of a Hero

756.desc: Arriving at the outskirts of the city you see a shockingly massive bridge. Before you can get to it you must confront the huge dragon on your tail.
756.name: Between Sea and Sky

760.desc: Now that you stand near the bridge it looks a lot bigger than it seamed from far away. You can see an ominous tower far in the distance, but could that be the end?
760.name: The Bridge to Ruin

761.desc: Turning back, you see the ruins. Compared to that desolate yet pure place, the bridge is soaked in an ominous miasma. What could be waiting ahead?
761.name: Denial of Death's Curse

762.desc: The closer you get to the tower, the more hightened your fear becomes. It's as if the tower itself was infused with some sort of evil energy.
762.name: Demon Sword's Flash

763.desc: You've finally made it to the bridge's halfway point. As the enemies are growing stronger, it seems fighting through the second half will only be more difficult.
763.name: Challenge from the Underworld

764.desc: Enemies continue attacking, allowing no room for rest. Could they be protecting the power that Paris said was hidden here?
764.name: Brave in the Face of Darkness

765.desc: You're close enough to the tower that you have to look up to see where it ends. It's odd appearance causes a lump in your throat.
765.name: A Hero's Destiny

766.desc: Not much longer to the tower. Lugina still hasn't shown up yet so it's highly likely he's waiting somewhere around here. Proceed with caution.
766.name: Duel on the Bridge

770.desc: There is a thick steel door at the entrance to the tower. Although it is open, you must defeat the monsters around you before going inside.
770.name: Gate of Rejection

771.desc: Entering inside you notice the entire tower is slightly trembling. You must shake off this bad feeling and focus on the enemy in front of you.
771.name: Hall of Annihilation

772.desc: It's a long way to the top, and on top of that there are even more enemies here than outside. What Paris said now stirs uneasiness within you.
772.name: Stairway to Extinction

773.desc: The tower's shaking has grown stronger. The oppressive rythmic sound bears heavily on your chest. What is it that Paris saw here?
773.name: Corridor of Ruin

774.desc: What floor is this? Suddenly looking outside, the once massive bridge now looks relatively small. The top is near, prepare yourself and move forth.
774.name: Period of Mortality

775.desc: This could be the final floor. However, you feel the presence of the Four Heroes coming from behind the door leading to the roof. You must defeat them to advance.
775.name: Extermination Barrier

776.desc: You can hear a ghastly noise coming from the roof. It's the final gate protecting Lizeria's hidden power. Muster your courage and go forth.
776.name: The Corpse Producing Machine

780.desc: You can feel the immense energy coming from the depths of the lake. But for what purpose does it continue to radiate the surface?
780.name: The Presence Under the Surface

800.desc: A thick fog hangs around you as the light stench of rotten eggs fills the air. Be careful as it would all be over if you fell in the hole from which the steam pours.
800.name: Battle in a New Land

801.desc: It's like a steam bath here, the hot steam making it hard to breathe. It'd be difficult to wear armor travelling through a place like this.
801.name: The Steamy Path

802.desc: It's hot. Some cold water would be nice, but there's nothing here but boiling water. You're drenched in sweat, might as well wash off while you're here.
802.name: Blazing Earth

803.desc: Pushing aside the steamy air, a scorching hot wind blows in. The parched air instantly dries your once sweat covered body.
803.name: Swift Blowing Flames

804.desc: A wind blows in from outside. It's fresh feel invigorates you. However, you sense a powerful thirst coming from where the wind is blowing. It's likely a strong foe.
804.name: Dragon Captain's Roadblock

810.desc: All you see goes from steam to snow, and your once steaming hot body is instantly cooled. Worried about Karl, you continue after him.
810.name: A White World

811.desc: Before you notice, your once wet hair and clothes are frozen. Surely you'll catch a cold in this radically changing weather. Brush away the frost and hurry ahead.
811.name: Standing in the Snow

812.desc: The sprawling snowscape before you is gorgeous, but as much as you'd like to stare this isn't the time to get distracted. You must catch up to Karl.
812.name: The Rainbow Crowned Queen

813.desc: You notice that the softly falling snow is starting to cover Karl's tracks. You must find him before you lose trace of him.
813.name: A Wave of Blades

814.desc: As you traverse the whitewashed landscape, you're surprised by a firm, icy sound. It's the echo of icy gunfire headed your way!
814.name: The Swift Marksman

820.desc: Plants that you've never seen before flourish everywhere. Smash your way through this overflowingly vibrant forest just as Seria would expect you to.
820.name: The Forest's Uneasy Peace

821.desc: It's hot and humid in this dark forest. It's not as hot here as it was in that steamy cavern, but you're already beginning to sweat.
821.name: One Day in the Woods

822.desc: Various strange flowers bloom proudly around you. Their mixing smells produce a strange aroma. It's almost...intoxicating...
822.name: The Ancient Forest's Guardian

823.desc: From far away you thought you saw a large tree, but now it seems to be coming toward you. Is this an illusion, or is the tree really moving?
823.name: The Roar in the Forest

824.desc: As sunlight begins to peek into the forest, it seems you might be able to get out. Karl and Seria are in the ruins ahead. You must hurry to them.
824.name: The Sal Trees

830.desc: You must escape the ruins to get to the tower where Karl is being held. Tilith can take care of Seria, so hurry ahead as fast as you can.
830.name: The Thunder Troupe

831.desc: The ruins are quite old, but magic still illuminates the area. What's strange, however, is that it isn't fire, but the power of thunder magic which is being used.
831.name: Secret of the Blade

832.desc: As rough as the inside of the ruins is, they still seem to be intact. There also don't appear to be any traps to protect from intruders, but still...
832.name: That Which Haunts the Ruins

833.desc: It seems these ruins were once used as a fortress. There are armories lined with spears, though each one of them is covered with rust.
833.name: Fall of the Lightning Fortress

834.desc: You sense a strong enemy near the exit to the ruins. Zevalhua's disciple Mare was able to read Seria's movements in attacking her. Be careful.
834.name: The Spear of Justice

840.desc: A wind gently blows through the soft sunlight. Exiting the ruins, you seem to be on the side of a mountain. The sky is clear and the weather is pleasant.
840.name: The Pegasus Maiden

841.desc: Could this path also be part of the ruins? The moss covered path and crumbling statues show the passage of time. Still, this is no time to relax.
841.name: The Foreboding Gunshot

842.desc: The air is invigorating here. It'd be nice to stop here and take a deep breath. The view is so beautiful, maybe you can return here after Karl is rescued.
842.name: Heavenly Intent

843.desc: The mountain path slowly turns downhill. As your trip around this beautiful mountain comes to an end you almost feel sad, but you must hurry forward.
843.name: The Warrior and the Dragon

844.desc: The cave is wide open before you. You should be able to get to the tower through here. You'd better prepare yourself for surprise attacks.
844.name: Evil Conviction

850.desc: Entering the cave from the bright mountain path, your eyes have yet to adjust. Despite the dim light, the cave is considerably dark.
850.name: Thick Darkness

851.desc: Why was Karl kidnapped? Mare said she wished to show him the truth, but still...Karl is your closest friend. You must save him.
851.name: The Coiling Shadows

852.desc: Thanks to the torch you can see ahead of you, but the ground is still dark. The flickering torch seems to make the darkness appear thicker.
852.name: King of the World Below

853.desc: The stench of death wafts through the air from the deep darkness. Where could this cave lead? This darkness is really unsettling.
853.name: Unshakeable Fear

854.desc: A pungent rusty metal odor pours into your nose. It's the smell of blood! The exit ought to be near, but there's no doubt something dreadful is waiting ahead.
854.name: A Glorious Bloody End

860.desc: Running alongside a white wall, you chase after the dragon that injured Tilith. Following its trail should lead you to where Karl is.
860.name: Fletchings of Anticipation

861.desc: There's a sturdy tower intricately built from white stones. From its appearance, it looks like it was built as a military fortress, but it feels creepy.
861.name: The Indestructible Formation

862.desc: Hurry up the ivory stone steps. Who knows what kind of traps Mare set up ahead. Aim for the top, and proceed calmly, but quickly.
862.name: Freezing Stillness

863.desc: Is Karl all right? Just as Tilith said, there must be a reason why Karl is being kept alive, so his life shouldn't be in danger, but still…
863.name: Wedging Deep

864.desc: The enemy's attacks have gotten stronger. Perhaps you're nearing the top. With this much resistance, it must mean that Karl is ahead!
864.name: Rallying Spirits

865.desc: A sudden surge of blood curdling power seeping down from the floor above stops you in your tracks. Prepare yourself and head up to where your two foes await.
865.name: Exceeding Defiance

866.desc: The top level of the white tower. The dragon slowly turns its gaze to you, and lets out a deafening roar. You have to defeat it and save Karl!
866.name: The Roar of Triumph

900.desc: The city is enormous, befitting the once prosperous capital of an empire. Though it's smaller than Randall, make sure you don't get lost.
900.name: Hotatsu Dance

901.desc: Every building in the city looks plain yet sturdy. The fact that they've survived the ravages of war is testament to their expert craftsmanship.
901.name: Wild Bravery

902.desc: Lugina told your enemies to do their worst, but they are fiercer than you anticipated. Their spirit of kinship and heroism permeates the air.
902.name: Fire Maiden's Table

903.desc: You are still surprised that Lugina is cooperating in Karl's rescue. Though his words suggest otherwise, he isn't such a bad person.
903.name: The Knight in Crimson

904.desc: You have reached the opposite gate. Though there are no signs of Mare, you can sense a sinister heat approaching.
904.name: Guiding Light

910.desc: The beach is peppered with Lugina's footprints. He warned you not to follow him, but you have no choice. You proceed along the shoreline.
910.name: Serenade in the Waves

911.desc: The comfortable sea breeze is a perfect complement to the sun's strong rays. But you don't have time to enjoy it and must keep searching for where Karl is being held.
911.name: The Shining Ice Flow

912.desc: Though walking along the shore reminds you of your time with Tilith back at Morgan, there is no time for reminiscing. Brace yourself and press ahead.
912.name: The Limits of Wisdom and Courage

913.desc: Unlike the weather, the sandy terrain is less than ideal for combat. Walking so far from the city has also exhausted you.
913.name: Unwavering Slash

914.desc: As you approach the end of the beach, the sand turns to mud. If experience has taught you anything, something formidable should be waiting ahead.
914.name: The Ice that Binds

920.desc: Mare the demon is a master of deception. Her last words may be a ruse. However, her next attack could be imminent.
920.name: Overwhelming Green

921.desc: An exquisite view fills your eyes, of geological formations you have never seen. Use extra caution as you proceed.
921.name: Balance of Power

922.desc: You cannot rely on Lugina against Mare's tricks. Though you want to preserve your energy for your solo fight, the enemies' attacks just get fiercer.
922.name: Noble Roar

923.desc: You worry about Karl's safety in the hands of Mare. However, now is the time to hurry ahead, not to think ominous thoughts about your friend.
923.name: The Power that Protects

924.desc: The terrain here is not as rough. Perhaps this is where Mare will strike. Prepare yourself for her attack.
924.name: To Sacrifice One's Body

930.desc: Dark clouds drape the sky above, punctuated by incessant lightning that racks your nerves. You must sneak past carefully, ready for Mare's next attack.
930.name: Sound of Destruction

931.desc: The placement of enemies is no accident. They were planted with great precision to wear you down, serving you up on a platter for Mare.
931.name: Accumulation of Lightning

932.desc: The enemies' vicious attacks are taking their toll. However, this is hardly the place to catch your breath, for Karl's life is in your hands.
932.name: Pulverizing Combo

933.desc: Mare's strategy must be working exactly as planned. Almost completely worn out, you are practically a sitting duck for her.
933.name: Blades of Lightning

934.desc: The ominous clouds begin to clear, a sign that you may have made it out of your crisis. Yet taking a break now would be most dangerous.
934.name: Time to Vanquish

940.desc: Perhaps Mare is afraid of the power some humans wield. That would explain her incessant attempts to wear you down.
940.name: Soaring through the Sky

941.desc: The air wafting through the tomb seems fresh and clean. Judging by the inscriptions on the wall, this place dates back to the Agni Empire.
941.name: Where the Light Points

942.desc: Fighting your enemies here makes you feel like a tomb raider. There don't seem to be too many booby-traps set in the tomb, but be careful.
942.name: The Royal Bodyguard

943.desc: Continuing this solo battle is both physically and emotionally taxing. Try not to worry about Karl, or you'll play right into Mare's hands.
943.name: The Light that Vanquishes Evil

944.desc: A salty breeze wafts through the tomb, hinting at where it extends. Perhaps Karl is being held there.
944.name: Tombstone of Light

950.desc: Seria is as reckless as always. You worry about her wounds but can't stop now. You thank her for her impeccable timing and proceed onward.
950.name: Undying Wish

951.desc: The cave connected to the tomb seems to extend even further below the sea. The damp air makes you shiver as it tickles the back of your neck.
951.name: Living for Battle

952.desc: The cave is even darker than the pitch black seafloor above it. Because of this, creatures of the dark have free reign.
952.name: Bound by Darkness

953.desc: The stench of death that fills the cave twists your imagination in an ominous way. However, you pray that Lugina is able to rescue Karl.
953.name: Released by Shadows

954.desc: Somehow, the cave exhibits signs of human civilization. Could there be manmade structures this far below the sea?
954.name: An Offer of Death

960.desc: You must properly thank Lugina later for securing Karl's safety. Being Mare's prisoner must not have been a cakewalk.
960.name: Pillars of Green

961.desc: Your exhaustion from the journey to rescue Karl has worn off. Perhaps the strong human bond between you that Mare loves to mock has its benefits.
961.name: The Red Gate

962.desc: The shrine at the bottom of the ocean has a confusing, unearthly aura. The fact that Lugina was able to find Karl here is impressive.
962.name: The Golden Hall

963.desc: Rescuing Karl surely threw a wrench into Mare's plans. If you can attack her head-on and avoid her trickery, you have quite a fighting chance.
963.name: The Blue Hallway

964.desc: The enemy attacks increase further in ferocity. But their primitive, brute force approach is evidence that you are hot on Mare's tail.
964.name: The White Altar

965.desc: You have reached the innermost area of the shrine. You will have to defeat the remaining enemies here before you flush Mare out, but do not worry: you are not alone.
965.name: The Black Candelabrum

966.desc: At last you have found Mare in a room at the back of the altar. Show her that she is no match for the human bond you share with your friends.
966.name: Trespasser into the Mind

970.desc: It is said a ghastly spirit is sealed away deep within this gloomy dungeon home to dark secrets left from the Agni Empire.
970.name: The Imprisoned Tyrant

1000.desc: A world of inferno awaits you as you proceed further into the dark cave. The molten lava glows brightly, but behind it lies a sinister darkness.
1000.name: Scorching Roars

1001.desc: Who knows how long the simmering lava has been waiting in this cave for its chance to rise to the surface. Soon its pressure will force it out.
1001.name: A Torch in the Darkness

1002.desc: This land is said to inspire the spirit of warfare in its inhabitants. Judging from the enemies standing in your way, this seems to be true.
1002.name: The Commander of Fire

1003.desc: The scalding lava plunges at you all of a sudden. If it hits you, you'll suffer far more than fourth degree burns. However, worse dangers lie ahead...
1003.name: An Encounter with Flames

1004.desc: A hero wielding a sword of fire waits ahead. You must somehow sneak past the mix of holy and unholy flames and make it out of the cave.
1004.name: Sword of Fire

1010.desc: Frozen winds rush at you. The fact that the black cave of molten lava exists so close to this snowfield reminds you that nature is a force to be reckoned with.
1010.name: Battling the Ice Dragon

1011.desc: You take a peek in all directions and are met with stark whiteness. Try not to lose your sense of direction. Follow the sparse trees and the sun's movements.
1011.name: Snowbound Waypoints

1012.desc: Just as with Karl, you have faith that Grahdens is safe. But your loss of words to console Karl is regrettable.
1012.name: Brave through the Ice

1013.desc: You sense a sudden drop in temperature around you. Judging from experience, this means danger is not far off.
1013.name: Princess of the Snowscape

1014.desc: A wielder of ice magic carrying a terrifying axe stands in your way. A fierce battle is about to start, but make it quick. The snowfield's exit is near.
1014.name: The Blizzard Begins

1020.desc: The verdant ocean of trees lives up to its name. Wherever you look, the sun's rays are blocked by lush greenery. Under your feet, the ground is covered in grass and moss.
1020.name: Hunter in the Green

1021.desc: Unlike the tundra, the forest is full of what looks like landmarks. But they are starting to lead you astray as you trip over the thick grass.
1021.name: Trials in the Forest

1022.desc: All of a sudden, sunshine bathes you as the old growth gives way to young foliage. The fresh flowers are a pleasure to your senses.
1022.name: Pretty Little Flowers

1023.desc: You happen upon an old tree that manages to stand out in the ocean of its peers. Though not much taller than the others, it is far wider. You must make your way around it.
1023.name: The Majestic Trees

1024.desc: Further into the ocean of trees you see some covered in exquisite flowers. Their petals rain down as the armored princess and gunner from another world approach.
1024.name: Showdown under the Flowers

1030.desc: Leave Lugina and Seria to their own devices for now. Around this bog are the lingering traces of civilization, as if it was once someone's home.
1030.name: Lightning Strikes

1031.desc: Rain pours down with incessant lightning. Just as you start to suspect that enemies lurk here, an ambush strikes from above!
1031.name: Trial by Firestorm

1032.desc: You proceed around the outskirts of the bog as the rain drenches you. The enemy attacks are as relentless as the storm, taking their toll on your stamina.
1032.name: Blade of the Heart

1033.desc: The cacophony of thunder threatens to burst your eardrums. Each time the lightning strikes, so do your enemies' swords, raising the hair on the back of your soaked neck.
1033.name: Earth Shattering Lightning Storm

1034.desc: You reach the opposite end of the marsh. It doesn't seem like Grahdens is being held anywhere around here. Proceed to the sea.
1034.name: Terminal Thunderstorm

1040.desc: The sun starts to dye the sky a blood orange hue. Though you can't see the tower Tilith spoke of, it mustn't be far. Keep going.
1040.name: Lightning to the Heart

1041.desc: Mare's abduction of Karl was an act of suicide. But why would Zevalhua take Grahdens captive?
1041.name: The Long Shot

1042.desc: The sea breeze feels comfortable against your skin, as does the sunlight coming from your left. But do not let your guard down.
1042.name: Protection at All Costs

1043.desc: The rocky stretch under took some getting used to. But now that you have your feet planted, it's the perfect fighting ground.
1043.name: Impending Radiance

1044.desc: At this time of day, you must pay attention to your position in battle. When your enemies stand between you and the sun, their movements are hard to read.
1044.name: Light from Above

1045.desc: You avoided the god of destruction, but now you must face the warrior with eight blades on her back. This is a crucial stage--your enemies have no plans to rest.
1045.name: Daylight behind Her

1050.desc: These ruins were once the capital of Agni, known as Mirvana. Exposed to the worst of warfare, the city still bears its scars.
1050.name: Those Who Live by the Sword

1051.desc: At time there are cracks in the darkness that appear to bones. Your ears pick up on what sounds like the woeful cries of long dead soldiers.
1051.name: Penetrate the Impenetrable Dark

1052.desc: The festering miasma in this town is not simply the remnants of warfare. You are certain that forbidden curses were used in these parts.
1052.name: The Endless Blackout

1053.desc: Judging by the dismal state of the town, the people kept fighting even after the surrounding walls were destroyed. Their determination is to be respected.
1053.name: Protector, Destructor

1054.desc: Something unusual stands before you amidst the rubble. Made of metal, it appears to be a summoned hero. Proceed slowly.
1054.name: Lingering in the Ruins

1055.desc: The smell of blood coming from near the gate opposite to the one you entered fills your nostrils. The tower is clos, but so is a very powerful enemy force.
1055.name: Broken Days

1060.desc: You finally reach the tower atop the cape. Head for its top for your showdown against Zevalhua. Defeat the Fallen God so you can save Grahdens!
1060.name: Dance in the Clouds

1061.desc: Sunlight pours into the tower, as if cheering you on. But you must have no time for such thoughts and must head upward toward your enemy.
1061.name: Prayer at Dawn

1062.desc: A hero from another world is waiting for you on this floor. Though it will not be an easy fight, it should be a fair one since you made it this far.
1062.name: Drenched in Crimson

1063.desc: As you climb up the stairs, you see a tremendous enemy blocking the sunlight. Make the heroes before you proud and trounce this ten-winged tormentor!
1063.name: The Golden Halo

1064.desc: You have never felt air this thick with tension and signs of enemies nearby. Prepare yourself, for the next battle may be your last.
1064.name: The Rainbow Battlefield

1065.desc: Everybody knows of the hero from Agni clad in flames. His reputation precedes him, like the sinister air that fills the passageway in front of you.
1065.name: The Burning Hero

1066.desc: You have made it to the top of the tower after defeating the burning hero. But now you must do what the gods couldn't and defeat the Fallen God Zevalhua!
1066.name: The Divine Emperor

1100.desc: The air is scolding hot above the boiling lava. Despite the surroundings, Paris's expression remains cool.
1100.name: Absolute Heat

1101.desc: The hot air burns to the touch. This is all too familiar, though, surely the fire wielding hero waits ahead.
1101.name: Whirling Vapors

1102.desc: Flames rise from the lava, robbing you of the little oxygen which remains, and the further you run ahead, the more fiery heroes block your path.
1102.name: Torrent of Flames

1103.desc: The cave ceiling is higher here. The surrounding flames are different in this area. What manner of flame waits ahead?
1103.name: Dancing Sparks

1104.desc: An overwhelming force stands in your way. Prepare yourself, as it seems the last Fallen God has sent forth the legendary Disastrous Beast.
1104.name: The Disasterous Beast

1110.desc: Zurg... What could the last of the Fallen Gods be plotting. You can't help but wonder as you gaze upon the beautiful aquatic metropolis.
1110.name: Young Lady's Guardian

1111.desc: You can see to the bottom of the beautifully flowing river. Remembering Zurg's words, you search for a path to Vriksha.
1111.name: Overflowing Power

1112.desc: A gorgeous palace stands in the center of town. However, the fountain in its courtyard stands frozen. Soon an ice wielding hero is upon you.
1112.name: The Frozen Palace

1113.desc: Leaving the palace alongside the river, the surface of the water suddenly explodes. The water freezes above as bullets of ice are shot your way.
1113.name: The Parting Waters

1114.desc: You can see a massive object blocking the exit from the Sea Capital. There's no mistake, it's the legendary freezing weapon.
1114.name: Ice Walled Fortress

1120.desc: This forest was once home to a prosperous city, the ruins of which can be seen periodically through the undergrowth. What could've happened to it?
1120.name: Dweller in the Depths

1121.desc: Though the way has been spotted with ruins, there are now none in sight. This area has likely been a simple forest since long ago.
1121.name: The Endless Forest

1122.desc: The heroes who block your path are the same ones who once opposed the gods. Now summoned by those same gods, what could they be thinking?
1122.name: Deep in the Green

1123.desc: Though Lugina warned you not to overthink things, you can't help but get lost in thought. Something just isn't right.
1123.name: Mother Forest

1124.desc: You're nearly out of the forest, but you must defeat the legendary guardian before you. Prepare yourself as you face off with the stone-like guardian.
1124.name: Stonewall Defender

1130.desc: Just past the bridge is Alnakeid Castle. You must defeat the wicked presence there to proceed to Vriksha, as far off as it may still be.
1130.name: Lightning Blockade

1131.desc: Passing the castle walls, you venture through a watch tower to find another wall. The roar of lightning around you holds the power of a massive army.
1131.name: Intersecting Light

1132.desc: Doubt grows within you. The Four Fallen Gods should have been fighting together. What difference is there in the disputes between gods and humans?
1132.name: Shocking Courage

1133.desc: There are now cracks to be found in the fortress walls. As unnecessary as it is, the stronghold between the three capitals still serves its purpose.
1133.name: Surging Spirit

1134.desc: A fight awaits you at Danrard's final gate. You're greeted by an angel who once took to the sky in search of freedom.
1134.name: Treacherous Angel

1140.desc: Though it now lies in ruins, the town remains lit by a glass-sided, gravestone-like tower. The scene is quite mysterious.
1140.name: Talented War Maiden

1141.desc: Could scenes like this be commonplace in the otherworld? Also, what happened to the god who was supposed to have destroyed this town?
1141.name: The Last Defender

1142.desc: It seems the cave just outside the city could be your way to Alnakeid Castle. Surely, incredibly powerful foes await you there.
1142.name: Light's Oppression

1143.desc: The lit path you walk suddenly opens up into a large plaza. You're awaited by a just swordsman and the roar of a dragon.
1143.name: Justice's Obstruction

1144.desc: You spot a white figure in front of the gate leading from the town. Is it the legendary Keeper of Order? All you can do is fight your way through.
1144.name: Keeper of Order

1150.desc: Tilith seems to be acting strange. On top of that, even Paris isn't her normal cool self. What's going on?
1150.name: Power in the Darkness

1151.desc: An oddly glowing crystal floats inside the darkened cave. Stare at it too long and you might find yourself under its spell.
1151.name: A Seductive Trap

1152.desc: As the enemy's attack reaches a whole new level, you sense a powerful force coming from deep inside the cave. Surely, a strong foe awaits.
1152.name: Power of the Abyss

1153.desc: Exhausted by all the fighting, you stop for a quick break. However, upon moving forward a chill runs down your spine. Something wicked lies ahead...
1153.name: Scattered Death

1154.desc: Feeling the wind, you realize you might soon be out of the cave. But before proceeding, you must first defeat a legendary demon.
1154.name: The Half-Demon Girl

1160.desc: Entering the hall, you're surrounded by enemies. You must defeat them before moving forward, as exhausted as you may be.
1160.name: Mother Nature's Song

1161.desc: Leaving the hall, you come across a pair of foes harvesting the powers of light and dark. Defeat the minions before taking on these two.
1161.name: Light & Dark Concerto

1162.desc: You exit into a grand space decorated with swords. The countless scars that adorn the walls and pillars show the intense battle that took place here.
1162.name: Dancing Light Blades

1163.desc: This seems to be the courtyard. It is lined with beautiful sculptures, and the pond is filled with clean water. However, enemies still lurk nearby.
1163.name: Dance of Ice

1164.desc: Entering once again inside, your eyes spot a great fireplace glowing red. Nearby, in the dimly lit room, stands a chair made of leather.
1164.name: Crimson Waltz

1165.desc: You exit onto the castle's roof. The god Zurg spoke of should be at the top of the tower ahead. However, a hero of lightning blocks your way.
1165.name: Symphony of Thunder

1166.desc: You've reached the spiral staircase inside the tower of the castle. It isn't tall, but it's full of enemies, the strongest awaiting you at the end.
1166.name: Call of the Storm

1200.desc: It seems that Zurg's words are still bothering Tilith. Keep moving forward to bring her spirits back up, never looking back.
1200.name: Exploding Volcano

1201.desc: Though the temperature is rising, the morale of your party never wanes. Combine your powers and aim for the last Fallen God together.
1201.name: Sacred Bird of Flame

1202.desc: The cries of the drake echo through the mountains, but this is no foe to fear now. Make your way through the scorching path ahead as fast as you can.
1202.name: Fire Drake Cry

1203.desc: As if answering to your fighting spirit, strong warriors await ahead. Enveloped in wings of flames, these two swordsmen are swelling with energy.
1203.name: Joint Wings Ablaze

1204.desc: A gigantic shadow blocks your path at the top of the mountain. It seems there is no way to pass through the volcano without a confrontation.
1204.name: Power of Survival

1210.desc: It looks like something's on Tilith's mind. If everyone said they trust her, then what could be wrong? It's a tad worrisome.
1210.name: Battle of the Coast

1211.desc: Surprised by the sounds of footsteps, they turn out to be only small crabs. Walking on the rocky area washed by the waves, you feel like you'll slip.
1211.name: Dragon in the Abyss

1212.desc: The sounds of waves mix with a voice in song. They sing the magical song of a water spirit. The enemy isn't strong, but don't let it slow you down.
1212.name: Crystal Love Song

1213.desc: You reach the sand after the rocky area. A hero with an ambition as great as the sea, and another with a will of ice, ambush you upon arrival.
1213.name: Recital of  Waves

1214.desc: The cliff in the distance you were headed towards begins to move. It was actually your enemy, and you have no choice but to defeat it to move forward.
1214.name: Overwhelming Power

1220.desc: What could be the truth Zurg keeps mentioning? Regardless of how reliable his testimony may be, it still gets the imagination going.
1220.name: Forest of Illusion

1221.desc: The forest capital of Vriksha. Seeing how much it truly differs from the Vriksha of yore, you can't help but wonder what happened to this country.
1221.name: The Great Tree's Life

1222.desc: Strange, this is the same path you took before. It seems that the forest is enchanted. You must find the source of this spell and eliminate it.
1222.name: A Fairy's Smile

1223.desc: Exiting to an open space lit by the sun, the birds shriek. A hero with a weapon from another world, and another with a magic lance, stand before you.
1223.name: Dark Green Concerto

1224.desc: A mountain made of stone suddenly appears before you. Just when you thought it was in your way, it swings at you. It's a puppet controlled by magic!
1224.name: Defense at Any Cost

1230.desc: Though Paris is hostile towards the Summoners' Hall, there's a particular antagonism in the air when she looks at Grahdens. It must mean something.
1230.name: Poisonous Swamp

1231.desc: Water tainted red and a mysterious creature shining light by it. Out of all the places you've been to so far, this one feels the eeriest. Be careful.
1231.name: Collapse of the Beast

1232.desc: A deafening voice combined with the flash of thunder. A bird soars the skies creating electric shocks as it revolves. But it's not just one bird...
1232.name: Thunder Batter

1233.desc: As the thunder clouds roar in the sky, rain starts to fall. At the same time, two heroes appear and obstruct your path. You sense a fight is imminent.
1233.name: Lightning Feast

1234.desc: The rain has ceased and light trickles through the clouds. As if on a staircase of light, an angel descends. Defeat her and proceed to the Sky Palace.
1234.name: Unleashed Power

1240.desc: No matter how true Zurg's words may be, helping him to destroy humans is not an option. Of course, you wouldn't betray the Goddess anyway.
1240.name: Peaceful Garden

1241.desc: You can't believe that such a beautiful garden floats in midair just like that. What sort of magic could be at work here?
1241.name: The Supreme Dragon

1242.desc: A fighting goddess forbids you from moving forward, as if she cannot forgive those who disturb her garden. However, there's no stopping now.
1242.name: The Gods' Martial Art

1243.desc: You reach the castle at the heart of the garden. When you set foot there, a hero wielding a holy blade and a knight with a great sword appear.
1243.name: The Knight's Guidance

1244.desc: You can see the gate that marks the exit of the Sky Palace. However, in front of it stands a shiny and pale king of beasts. It's time for battle.
1244.name: The Power of Guidance

1250.desc: Tilith seems to be feeling better, which is a relief. No one else is hung up on Zurg's words either. With a unified front, head towards Adan's Tower.
1250.name: Fortress of Ignorance

1251.desc: This eerie place makes it feel like ghosts could appear at any moment. Proceed with caution. You're getting closer to enemy territory now.
1251.name: Death God of Darkness

1252.desc: A feeling of uneasiness lingers in the air, but you travel lightly on your feet. Knowing you must defeat the Fallen God, there's no time to waste.
1252.name: Demon King's Reign

1253.desc: The ill wills of revenge and madness prevent you from stepping any further. The hero waiting ahead looks powerful, so prepare yourself.
1253.name: The Fury of Darkness

1254.desc: A young woman awaits outside the rear gate of the castle. It would seem she's holding a sword in her right hand, and concentrated magic on the other.
1254.name: Piercing Power

1260.desc: The surroundings are overflowing with the presence of the enemy. Head for the top while Karl serves as a distraction. The real battle draws near.
1260.name: Gate of Invitation

1261.desc: You cannot find the staircase that leads upstairs, so you take the only way available deep inside. The path seems slanted, slowly curving upwards.
1261.name: The Endless Hallway

1262.desc: The curved hallway spirals upwards and upwards. If you stumble when you lose in battle, you may end up tumbling all the way down...
1262.name: The Crooked Slope

1263.desc: You reach the top to find a large room. As if the same type of powerful enemy had been waiting for you all along, you're suddenly attacked.
1263.name: Black Hole Plaza

1264.desc: You go upstairs, open the doors, and find another large room. After just one step, the doors close and a strong enemy is summoned. Just a bit more.
1264.name: Path of No Return

1265.desc: After a fierce battle, you climb your way up through some narrow stairs. On your way to the top an enemy shows itself, but there's no going back now!
1265.name: Narrow Stairs

1266.desc: Finally at the top, there's no doubt that Zurg is waiting. If you defeat the disciple of the last Fallen God, Afla Dilith will be the only enemy left!
1266.name: The Speech Maker

1300.desc: You look far into the distance and notice the shadow of an eerie castle. They say that it is the last form Afla Dilith morphed into...
1300.name: Desert Hound

1301.desc: The footprints of Lugina and the others who had gone ahead have vanished. Strong gusts of wind hit the sand dunes, continuously changing their shape.
1301.name: Smoldering Sun
